alert.note: Alert for Mayaguez and Vicinity (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued September 05 at 10:32PM ADT until September 06 at 7:00AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to breaking waves up to 6 feet, and occasionally higher. * WHERE...Beaches along the western coast of Puerto Rico near Rincon. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents that can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water where it becomes difficult to return to safety.
info.instruction: Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away from shore, which occur most often at low spots or breaks in the sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as groins, jetties and piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards, beach patrol flags and signs. A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions.
